website_summaries.verdict: The Brother MFC-7860DW and its autodocument feeder, wireless connectivity, and simple installation make it an apt match for small businesses with moderate printing needs.
pros: Brother makes it easy to network the MFC-7860DW with collaborators, and its modest price tag makes sense for budget-minded shoppers
cons: Larger offices will feel cramped by the printer's small paper input tray and 10,000-sheet recommended output per month

customer_reviews.title: I was expecting better from BROTHER
customer_reviews.text: works well for a while and then gets this "off line" printing message and i had to restart the printer again and again until that did not work anymore. I tried to troubleshoot it / nothing worked. Technical support from brother was not an option anymore since it was couple of months past the warranty.( they charge you ). so it is a VERY EXPENSIVE PRODUCT for just a little over a year of use. I was expecting better from BROTHER.
customer_reviews.author: el

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer for Macs
customer_reviews.text: I have a Brother 9840CDW at home, that works great wirelessly for my Macs (printing, scanning.) My folks who have Windows and Macs went through endless problems getting their Macs (and sometimes Windows computers) to work together with a printer. Many printers did not have Mac specific drivers so compatibility had to be kluged, or even had to be connected to their Windows computer with the Mac connecting to that shared printer to use it. With this MFC7860DW, every PC, Mac, MacBook, laptop, tablet and smartphone, etc. connects directly, wirelessly, easily and reliably so far, to print and scan with the Brother Mac drivers/software. Also we successfully printed and scanned with both a Samsung Galaxy SIII and and iPhone 4.
customer_reviews.author: Taser_This

customer_reviews.title: All in one covers all the bases for my home office.
customer_reviews.text: SO MUCH HAPPIER using a laser printer instead of an inkjet. Much less expensive to operate. Toner doesn't go stale if there's a long time gap between print jobs. Color printing at home is a novelty I found I really didn't need. Now that I don't have a home phone line, the fax function isn't utilized anymore, but I use the copier and duplex printing functions regularly. I have mine set up wireless, so print jobs from three computers, three phones, and two tablets all use WIFI. Brother has apps for your Apple and Android devices as well. It should be a good long time before this printer is obsolete.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Todd

customer_reviews.title: Bought in 2013 and still ticking - in business environment
customer_reviews.text: We are having an issue with one of our Brothers (we have 4 in the office), so I checked my oldest. This one. Bought in May of 2013. Still working beautifully. I'm shocked, really.
customer_reviews.author: June

customer_reviews.title: Good for small business or home office
customer_reviews.text: It is durable (purchased five years ago and is still working smoothly) and has all the essential functions needed for small business/home office. We have used both Brother’s and third party’s toners without experiencing any issue. This model does not support AirPrint and Google Cloud Print so you have to use the Brother iPrint & Scan app instead.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy JST

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: For the past few years I've only used Brother printers and MFCs. On the whole they have been pretty good and do what they say they can do. I do have some reservations. They eat toner like crazy. Even with the larger cartidge it seems like we're replacing them very frequently. Second, I bought this one because its predecessor began chewing up the paper I have to assume because the rubber rollers went bad after 2 years. Never could figure it out. Which leads me to my last and biggest issue and that is support. The support is automated and therefore useless. When the Brother runs it runs great. If some glitch happens - you're on your own
customer_reviews.author: Saul Nathanson

customer_reviews.title: ****INK AND DRUM GUZZLER*****
customer_reviews.text: We have a small office and this printer was an ink guzzler and would go through drums like nothing I have ever seen. It worked decent enough, not many troubles. We don't do a lot of printing and we used Brother ink and drums, but that didn't matter. You won't pay a lot of up front for this machine, but I guarantee you will sink a lot of money into this printer as the ink and drums are expensive.
customer_reviews.author: montanaTerianne

customer_reviews.title: poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer in 2013 as the second home printer and not regularly used. After my first inkjet printer stopped working, I started using it as the first printer. I changed the toner just two months ago but now I kept getting the error saying no paper. I cleaned the rollers as suggested in the advanced owner's manual. But no use. I would not recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Johnson

customer_reviews.title: RJM
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer, this is the first mono colored printer I have ever purchased. Decided to go this way because of good reviews and also I only find I need color maybe twice a year. I can go to an office store with my memory stick and have them print things for me for the amount it costs for color ink cartridges. Love the wireless feature for printing still trying to figure out why I can connect my computer to the printer and scan multiple pages into one file and when I can wireless I can only get one page per file. Anyone knows please share. Anyways great quality printer and the customer support is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: RJM

customer_reviews.title: Poor Customer Support - PC Fax will no longer work & customer support will not try to solve
customer_reviews.text: This printer will no longer work with the PC fax so that I can get my faxes on my PC. The hard fax still works but I need the PC fax backups. Called customer support several times. They end up saying their fax number to test my fax is temporarily down so they can't test it. It was apparent lie. They will not admit that the PC fax program just no longer works with Windows 10. Because I have two brothers printers - both with problems, I will no longer be purchasing Brother products because they failed to try to find a solution for this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Verified

customer_reviews.title: I have the app on my iPhone and love it, love it
customer_reviews.text: Everybody wants my printer/scanner/fax. I have the app on my iPhone and love it, love it, love it. Fast and met ALL expectations. UPDATE: Two years later, this MFC printer is going strong. It prints fast, the toner cartridges last a LONG time, I love the app on my iphone and using the printer from my laptop wirelessly is also a breeze. I really have nothing but good things to say. It doesn't jam, the print quality is good (I just do text printing - no photos) and the color scanning is great. Next time I might splurge on a color laser printer, but this is great for what my needs and budget were.
customer_reviews.author: LRC5555

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer, be prepared to buy a replacement toner after 200-300 pages. Printer comes with a low output "Starter" toner.
customer_reviews.text: This is working out to be a nice printer. The instruction manual could be improved, however when contacting Brother regarding questions they are very helpful and knowledgeable. I could not determine how to set up the Scan feature, contacted Brother and they were very helpful and the Scan works great. Be advised, as noted by other reviewers, the printer comes with a "Starter" toner. The low toner went off when only 314 pages were printed. The Amazon description should have this included in the description so that you are not surprised that you need to buy a replacement toner after a couple hundred prints.
customer_reviews.author: grumento

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value - no duplex scanning?!
customer_reviews.text: The price/feature combo is hard to beat. I bought it for the ADF and duplex printing. Wireless printing/scanning worked out-of-the-box. Great value indeed. For reasons difficult to fathom (except for product line tier-ing and pricing), I can't "manual duplex scan." (manual duplex = scan one side, flip around, scan the other side, software combine into one file with the right sequence). It has an ADF, it even has duplex printing, but no software support for duplex scan. It's not a hardware issue, it's purely software and they left it out... For no manual duplex scan support, 4 out of 5 stars. (otherwise it would have been 6 stars)
customer_reviews.author: Chi Ho Eric Cheung

customer_reviews.title: Brother MFC7860DW - Excellent Printer!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding printer! Had a Brother DCP 7020 for nine years, which ran flawlessly until recently. I tried an inexpensive Canon laser, but that did not work out and I returned it to Amazon. Decided to go with another Brother and I've not been disappointed. The wireless install took less than ten minutes; the scanning software is simple and very easy to use and there's a center pass-through for printing longer documents (I use it to print adhesive-backed, shipping labels). It's worth every penny, especially compared to the cheap Canon laser.
customer_reviews.author: MGA MKII

customer_reviews.title: Brother MFC7860DW - Another great Brother printer
customer_reviews.text: Our company has 4 models of Brother printers, including this one. I have to say that compared to other brands, such as HP, there is no comparison in my mind as to the better brand. We have had no problems with the Brother printers, they have run flawlessly to date. We've run both OEM and Non-OEM replacement cartridges in the printers and have had no issues either way. I highly recommend Brother if you're in the market for a printer and that includes this model.
customer_reviews.author: mkesales

customer_reviews.title: Brother Printer MFC7860DW
customer_reviews.text: Good product.Easy to install with the software CD included. I have 4 machines on the network. 2 computers 64 and two 32 bit processors. Also 2 hardwired and 2 wireless. All drivers were installed and printer works flawlessly. Easy to use from computer control center as well as from printer display. Scan quality is very good for color pictures and black and white documents. Printer works fast but a little bit noise.Manual Fax works good but auto Fax sometimes interfere with the answering machine and cancels incoming Fax. Problem is that both answering machine and Fax turns on after 4 rings.All in all I would definitely recommend this product for use at home or in small office.
customer_reviews.author: A. Shafir

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer for a Home Office
customer_reviews.text: More compact than previous models. The wireless set up takes some time, but once it is working you wonder how you survived without it. It handles every job very well, including lengthy tax returns. Some reviewers have commented on the noise level. I don't find the noise bothersome. For large print jobs carefully watch the out feed tray. The paper does not lie flat and square, which creates artificial height, which may create a paper jam at the out feed rollers. This is not a significant issue, just something to keep in mind when printing large jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Money Saver
customer_reviews.text: This printer is great, we switched from an inkjet which was just draining ink so we decided to try this printer. What a difference we save so much money in ink! We are both in college so we print a lot of documents we have had this printer for quite some time and we are still on our first ink cartridge. The wireless works great we have never had a problem with wireless printing. Though it does not print with the apple or google printing systems but they have their own app for the apple products (I am not sure about android or google).
customer_reviews.author: jlundin

customer_reviews.title: Great Multifunction Printer for the price
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the positive reviews, I decided to buy this printer, and I'm very happy about it. All the functions work perfectly. I have a Mac. It took me several hours reading the various manuals that come with it, but I was able to get everything up and running with no problems. The set-up CD that came with it would not work on my Mac, but it wasn't necessary. The information in the manuals is written first for PCs, but still has good Mac instructions. Overall, a very positive experience, and I would highly recommend the printer for the small home office. i have owned the machine for about a week.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Very good printer
customer_reviews.text: Hard to set up this wireless printer, but once you do, it is easy to use, scans, prints...it practically writes for you. We bought one. for our daughter, and liked it so well, we bought it for ourselves. If you find it hard to set up in the very beginning, stick with it. It's worth it. I can use it with my iPad using the Brother App but I did have to struggle with it for a bit trying to figure out just how to wireless print from my iPad. Someone more technology inclined probably wouldn't have any problem figuring out how to print wirelessly from the iPad.
customer_reviews.author: S. Iyer

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the home office
customer_reviews.text: Great printer for the home office. I try to stay away from inkjet printers because of their relative slowness and wastefulness, in addition to having to juggle different ink levels of color cartridges. This laser printer is fast, prints on both sides (minimizes waste) and has a scanner and fax. All functions work as expected. In my typical use pattern, I am still on the same toner cartridge whereas I would now be on the second black inkjet cartridge, or maybe even the third. You do the math... I have had it for a year now and I can say it is very reliable. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Fav Carnero

customer_reviews.title: Great Home Office MFC
customer_reviews.text: I use bigger Brothers at work but needed a all in one for home. It was on sale at the time for $169.00 -- not much more than may plain laser printers. Despite some other reviews, hookup was a snap, including the wireless connections and I downloaded the print app for my android phone with no problems. Pros: Works as advertised, relatively small footprint for an MFC, generic toners and drums make it very inexpensive to use. Cons: None at this time Other: Probably better for a home office or office with modest printing requirements. Sheet feeder and slot for receiving printed pages a bit small for most office production.
customer_reviews.author: Richmond

customer_reviews.title: so far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great so far. Because I am a mechanical man trapped in an electronic world, I asked a friend to "marry" my three computers to this new Brother laser printer once I had taken care of the preliminaries. That went smoothly for him. This is a back-up machine in case of problems with my primary all-in-one printer. Everything has worked as advertised. I was impressed by the copying speed of the new machine and I am happy that my per-copy cost will be but a fraction of the HP all-in-one printer. I bought a Brother because the two printers in my Florida home are Brothers, each of which has performed flawlessly--and cheaply.
customer_reviews.author: lieve from grand rapids

customer_reviews.title: Great printer!
customer_reviews.text: I've been eying this printer for a while because of its features, but also because my inkjet printer was costing an arm and a leg to operate, constantly needing ink cartridges. This printer is very economical and efficient. It's the first Brother printer I've ever owned/used, and I've always heard good things about them. I will definitely buy Brother printers in the future. This printer is very fast, prints double-sided automatically, and works with all of the computers in my network, wirelessly. It also has copy, scan, and fax functions, which I haven't had a chance to use yet, but the printing alone has me hooked. I highly recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: this is a great printer, wireless wonder, and a scanner too
customer_reviews.text: We use this in our MAC home network and it works like a charm, scanning items either from the glass or from the document feeder. It also prints great from any of our wireless devices. Even from the iPAD. We are please with its performance. This is such a good printer that I had my mom and dad get one because it was going to solve all of their connectivity problems at their place, and it simplified things. All of the MACs just "found" the printer when it was time to install on each machine/computer. I am not kidding. This was a "no hitch" install. Easy and flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Brother Printer MFC7860DW Wireless Monochrome Printer with Scanner, Copier...
customer_reviews.text: I received this printer quickly and it was packaged great. As of now, this is the best printer I have ever owned. I set it up on my wi-fi system and it works well with my IMac. The Fax, Scanner and printer work as advertised. Some of the functions took longer then I would of liked to figure out how to make them work so for the non tekkie, I would say you might need some help. It does two-sided printing, it's wi-fi capable, it scans, prints fast and best of all you do not have to deal with the color aspect of these lousy ink-jets. I will never go back to an ink-jet. I am one happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: Ron D

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: It was nice to find an all-in-one that was a laser printer. The wifi setup was easy, but I would suggest setting an IP address manually so you don't have to worry about the IP address changing every time the printer loses power. There is a Brother app that allows the printer to be used from any iOS devise without needing a "helper program" As others have mentioned, the sheet feeder feels flimsy, but I trust that this Brother printer will provide a long life like several other Brother printers I've had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I have used several all in one machines over the years. This is by far the BEST I have ever had. A big part of that may be this is a laser printer. The others were ink jet. It scans in color but will NOT print anything but black. That said, the large toner cartridge goes a very long way. I very much recommend this unit to anyone that needs a home printer for volume printing but does not require color.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Good printer...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first brother printer. I had old jet printer from Canon for about five years and cartridge cost so much, we sold it for $100 and decided to get this one. Now, we had this for about eight months and so far so good. I bought another toner with this printer but didn't have opportunity to use it. First toner which came with this is still in use. Brother TN450 HIgh yield toner claim up to 2000 pages. I think, this will lost us for a while. Printer is solid. I would recommend this printer if you are just looking for black and white.
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus C. Cha

customer_reviews.title: Besides that it's a great printer and I would recommend it anyways
customer_reviews.text: I would give this printer 5 stars, but I do have difficulty with the wireless connection sometimes. I have to clear the settings and reenter the information every once in a while. Besides that it's a great printer and I would recommend it anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Best laser printer ever! hands down!
customer_reviews.text: forget HP, Dell or Canon or any of these guys when it comes to laser printers. Brother takes the cake in this class. great features such as wireless printing, scanning and fax. The printer is compatible with my iphone and android devices so i can print and scan from and to my phone. Best of all, replacement cartrirdges are cheap as dirt and last 2000 pages. Heres the link to the replacement cartridge:
customer_reviews.author: imoorad

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to hook up, I have purchased another Brother type, and I liked it too. Now that my business has grown, this one was necessary. Very quiet, functions very well, never an issue. I have used Kodak and Cannon and this one was the best for the money, especially if you don't need or want "color". The toner is inexpensive, and lets face it, purchasing ink cartridges simply because ONE color either dried out or ran it gets expensive. Prints quickly, faxes really well, receives well, scanner has been easy and copy quality is great. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Alpenglow Vacation Rentals Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine!
customer_reviews.text: Between the 7840DN and the 7860DW, I own 6 of these and use them in my office. The scanning software that comes with it is quite good and allows me to OCR documents into usable text files about as good as the high-end scanners that I purchase prior to the Brothers. It does a nice job of converting documents into text and is an easy machine to use. the issue, of course, is toner. I experimented and found an expensive replacement cartridge that works quiet well. it helps to manage the cost. I have no regrets on any of these Brother machines.
customer_reviews.author: Georgie

customer_reviews.title: Printer is good. Scanner is just OK.
customer_reviews.text: Printer works as expected. Never had problems. Scanner is not good for photos. Scans have lines and color degradation. I don't use specific brother software. It scans to ftp location for me. So it's possible that software fixes those scan artifacts, but I wouldn't be so sure about that. Finally, I would say it's a 5 star for office use and about 3 stars as something used for photo scans, etc. Average would be 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Obormot

customer_reviews.title: Another great product from Brother
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for an older model Brother that the drum was at it end. I love that this printer is wireless, As it make printing to the printer from anywhere in the office seamless.The only negative to this printer that I've found is the auto sheet feed on top when copying or scanning document. Leave lines in the scan or copy. Not sure what the deal with that is, but using the flat bed scan or copy work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I had a Kodak ink jet. I bought the Kodak because they are reportedly cheap for ink. I did not find that to be the case. I don't print all that often and I was replacing ink cartridges on a monthly basis - expensive. So far I've done some printing and haven't had to replace the toner cartridge yet. It prints much faster than my old ink jet. It has a toner saver mode which I use. It is larger than my old printer, but it's in my office so who cares. I haven't owned it all that long (about a month I guess). So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Beef Smellington

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but beware: comes with 'starter cartridge'
customer_reviews.text: We bought this printer/copier to replace our worn out Ricoh Aficio 1515. This is a nifty little printer that has handled everything we've thrown at it. It would have garnered 5 stars except that it comes with a toner cartridge that lasted about 200 sheets of paper. You will have to buy a TN420 or TN450 cartridge to replace it. Another reason for the 4 star review is that it would not easily connect to our wireless network: the zero key is supposed to scroll through different symbols, but our printer it will only give us the * symbol.
customer_reviews.author: H. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Look no further
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer about 18 months ago and I have had no issues with it. Toner lasts a very long time and will pay for itself because of the cost difference between toner and ink. I researched a lot before I made my purchase, and I very seldom hand out five star reviews, but this truly is a quality printer. It would do well in an office or for home use (mine is for home use but I think it is much better than my work printer).
customer_reviews.author: Andy1125

customer_reviews.title: Great unit
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I really need to review this unit too thoroughly as many others have done that already. But I will add in my $0.02 and say that this printer is working out great for us at our shop. Everything works as expected and we are able to print, scan to and fax from any computer in the shop. The speed is decent, but if you don't need fax capability and want an absolute beast of a unit for only $50 more, go for the DCP8110DN. We have that one in our office and it is a dream. Super fast and does everything you ask of it. Can't really go wrong with brother monolasers these days.
customer_reviews.author: bmw5002

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Printer! Install a Bit Hairy.
customer_reviews.text: Great Printer and all in one! Get it, you will love it! The replacement ink is very affordable and all the components work together harmoniously. The only glitch is that darn software install. All I have to say about it is 'Oh, Brother!" We also bought a printer for my mother and same issue with the wireless install. The software directions are not easy to navigate and the quick install didn't work as it should. Make sure you reserve some time as the install is confusing and the download of the software seemed to be extra long indeed!
customer_reviews.author: carbonic

customer_reviews.title: Brother Printer MFC7860DW
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the price I paid $199 + free shipping. I'ts only about $30 more expensive than the similar (white) one to this (since no free shipping was offered on that one) but this machine (printer, scanner, copier and fax in one) in addition has automatic double-side printing (which I find useful) and wireless connection option. It also has somewhat faster printing and scanning at 27 pages per minute vs. 24 on the other one. You can buy cartridge for $15 (non-brand) lasting for about 2,600 pages. I would buy this product again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Stefak

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job well.
customer_reviews.text: Works well for what I do. I don't print a lot so ink jet printers don't work well for me, the ink cartridges dry up long before they're empty. This printer was easy to set up and prints well. My only complaint is that, for envelopes I have to turn it sideways, open the back cover, and flip two levers; then undo that after they’ve printed. Not a deal breaker, but kind of a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Craig A. Brumley

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this multifunction printer/fax/scanner to replace my fax/scanner in my office. It has wireless print capability that I am using on all of my computers and I am currently trying to find out why it doesn't work with my Android phone which should be cleared up with a call to customer service. Printing quality is excellent and it has a large paper reservoir for receiving faxes and printing. Duplexing works as advertised too. Great machine. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Alderman 1965

customer_reviews.title: Buy it only if you have patience
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. The manual feeder in front of unit is a bit tricky. You have to kinda time it just right. You can't preload paper in manual feeder before printing or it will say paper jam even if unit doesn't take in paper. When you do time it just right, it always spits out 2 papers. 1 copied paper & 1 blank paper. I did mess with the wifi function a bit when I first got the unit, let's just say it will take time to figure that out.
customer_reviews.author: Dae

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to install on any PC
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this printer for about 2 years now. I only use it at home so it doesn't see much action. I have gone thru one toner cartridge though. It does the job perfectly and the fact that it has no wires is a big bonus. It is easy to install on any PC, including the software for scanning. Never got any paper jams. I would definitely recommend this (or similar, upgraded versions).
customer_reviews.author: M. Ifrim

customer_reviews.title: Solid Printer, Scanner does not function with Wireless
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid wireless printer and fax machine. I have yet to be able to get the wireless scanner function to work properly even though I have had 3+ phone calls and other communications with Brother technical support (on Windows 7). I do allow for the fact that my own system could be a contributing factor to the inability of the wireless scanner to function, however, it's a bit disappointing as I really do need this feature. Others have mentioned the sound level, and I can't say I have any problem with the sound level of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: DavidCT

customer_reviews.title: Print quality is fine, but this printer is a VORACIOUS consumer of ...
customer_reviews.text: Print quality is fine, but this printer is a VORACIOUS consumer of toner and drums, so the amount of money spent on supplies, not to mention downtime and time shopping, far outweigh any economy gained by purchasing it. After several good experiences with Brother MFP devices, this one drove me to choose a competitor for its replacement less than a year later. If you have a small office or busy home, consider something else and steer away from this model.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph J Astrue

customer_reviews.title: Great quality & price
customer_reviews.text: Great printer. I'm sure it's even more impressive than I realize, but I just don't have time to figure out all the bells and whistles. I had it up & running in probably a half hour, including getting the wireless to work. Now that it runs, it's almost effortless. The only thing I would want is a bigger output tray. If I print off a 100 sheets, it'll start backing up after 50 or so, and finally jam. I just have to stick around and pull out the pile occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: Joelle Steffen

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: This combination machine has worked well for me though I do not use all of the many features it offers. I specifically needed a good flatbed scanner/copier and this works well for my use. It would be nice if the copy of a document was discharged a little farther outward so it is easier to see/remove but that's a minor nit pik. The scans I have done to PC with the included software have been excellent, so I'm pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: R. Engineering

customer_reviews.title: Best Printer for your money
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews about the noise while on sleep mode, I had second thoughts about buying this printer. This is a non existent problem as far as I am concern. The set up was easy and painless. I'm using it as a stand alone printer and our entire household is connecting and printing/scanning thru WiFi. My only complain is the scanner resolution is not as good as my HP Scanner but maybe this is software related. I will try to use Adobe Acrobat next time instead of the software that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: D. David

customer_reviews.title: Prints great. Fax is possessed
customer_reviews.text: Prints great. Fax is possessed. One day the Brother decided it was going to send a fax. Without anyone asking it to. Throwback Thursday I guess... Anyway, now it makes these loud dialing beeps in a normally quiet office and wastes paper on "Transmission Verification Reports". Power cycle does not solve the problem. I could not find an answer on Google otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: William Entriken

customer_reviews.title: Good value in a duplex type printer
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to replace my Bother 8060 printer but wanted a duplexer this time around and landed on this printer based on features and price. This printer carries the brunt of the printing load in our house. To date, both the duplexer and the paper tray have worked flawlessly with no jams or paper issues. My only complaint is the initial toner cartridge produced 400 prints when the "low toner" alert appeared. Is a standard toner cartridge too much to ask for??? I'm over it now and my only remaining observation is it is a bit noisy. The printer works as advertised and I would recommend this printer to anyone looking for an inexpensive quality workhorse.
customer_reviews.author: Etherlink

customer_reviews.title: Many prints for cheap.
customer_reviews.text: What this machine saves you in ink compared to a inkjet, it pays for itself. Ours is new,and we have no problems with it yet. Setting up the driver for the WiFi networking capabilities on our computers was a little bit of a pain in the rear. Once you do get your computers set up, it works flawlessly. This machine only prints black and white, but has many many features. Scanning, duplex printing, copying, faxing, its all there and they all can be done either through ethernet or WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: jerseydeval

customer_reviews.title: Solid MFC Printer
customer_reviews.text: Solid multi-function printer/scanner/fax for a reasonable price. Fairly easy installation - detected my wifi network quickly and was set to go in just a few minutes. I buy a lot of Brother Printers and this one is about par for the course for Brother. Pros: Quick install, inexpensive toner vs. other manufacturers Cons: Its been my experience that brother printers last a couple of years with heavy use. For home use, that should not be an issue. No Air Print support.
customer_reviews.author: Book Junkie, MD

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: works as expected. I use it with my iMac 2010 and Macbook Air 2011 and both connect to it over wifi and print well. scanning though, you have to be wired for the scan button to work. otherwise for wifi scanning you have to open the scanner dialog on the mac and click scan (in wifi only mode, pressing the scan button on the printer gives "check connection" error). Laser printing is a big step up from inkjet, very happy we made that jump. machine goes to sleep automatically when not in use so its very quiet in operation, wakes up and prints quick too which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Maro

customer_reviews.title: My God, easiest network printer I've ever installed!
customer_reviews.text: The product specifications speak for themselves. I have a Netgear dual band wireless router, with WIP. Within 10 minutes this thing was printing and scanning on the network simply by using WIP! After an hour, I'm blown away at how easy it was to set up, and can only infer that the equipment one uses makes a difference in how easy or hard the set up goes. Thanks Brother! (My only "hickup" came with Amazon, which initially overcharged me for the device). Buy it at $161, and you'll think you stole it!
customer_reviews.author: Maritime

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Works flawlessly and has been a workhorse. All functions are used on a regular basis. I have it located with the router so it is connected via an Ethernet cable, so no experience with a wireless connection. So happy I replaced the previous color inkjet unit with a B/W laser. I have an older inkjet when I absolutely must have color, which turned out to be almost never. Can't beat the speed, low cost of consumables and virtually jam-free operation, even operating in full duplex mode most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: The Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Quick, great copies and a whole lot cheaper than my previous inkjet
customer_reviews.text: Finally switched to a cartridge jet from inkjet and am totally impressed. Printing is so much quicker, quality is perfect, and most importantly, not having to replace expensive little inkjet cartridges every other month or so, due to the amount of printing I do. Have not tried the fax yet. The scanner works great. Cons: Its a bit noisy and remains on for several minutes before the motor shuts off. Not too bad, and overall I still give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: High Price
customer_reviews.text: Had to get a AIO since the old HP died - the scanner stopped working - The MFC 7860DW works extremely well. Had problems scanning through Paperport, but manage to resolve it. Bought it too early. Newegg and Brother has a special on a couple of weeks after I bought it for below $ 200.00 and I had to pay $ 250.00 for this printer. Bummer. As always, Amazon was excellent in its delivery. Received the merchandise in a couple of days, and had it working immediately. Would recommend this printer, especially if it below $ 200.00.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Houdini

customer_reviews.title: Great for my office
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer to replace my older MFC-8480DN. It was really easy to set up and use. I like the fact that I can have all of my incoming faxes readily available on my computer. I just wish that it was able to email them to me as opposed to me having to retrieve them, but it does notify you when it recieves a fax. It prints and scans fine and is overall a great all-in-one for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sobchex

customer_reviews.title: I love the fact that you don't go through ink like ...
customer_reviews.text: When scanning through the feeder it never scans straight, i can never get my envelops to print straight either in a completely different department on the printer. I love the fact that you don't go through ink like you do with the HP, but the scanning (which i use a lot ) Is vary poor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good printer for home or office
customer_reviews.text: I made the switch from inkjet recently after a history of frequent inktank purchases. I am so glad I did. This machine prints perfectly, the pages are straight, the black type is clear (I don't need color). The scanning function works well too: I can easily scan into a pdf and email that off, since I don't have a fax phone line to use anymore. The wirelessness allows me to move the printer anywhere without worrying about a wired connection to the router.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Another BROTHER For Us
customer_reviews.text: This represents our fourth Brother Printer. All have given us excellent service in the past for many years and few dollars. This one should be no exception. Set-up was a breeze, including wireless set-up. Brother makes everything easy. Having Apple computers quadruples the easiness factor. The print quality is super, and the wireless printing speed is very fast. I encountered absolutely no problems. We are very pleased with everything Brother!
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.

customer_reviews.title: Wifi option is great
customer_reviews.text: Autofeed multipage scan via the WIFI is just awesome, but you do need the software that comes with it on. On Windows 8 machine, it found the printer on the wireless network without installing anything. Print quality is fine and pretty fast. scan quality is fine, too. I just leave it on all the time and it goes to sleep whenever there is no activity and it's like total silence. I do not use the fax option. Lifting the cover and closing the cover makes this awkward transition.
customer_reviews.author: D. Chieng

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: We really like this printer. Read the other reviews and am not experiencing the other "cons" that other reviewers mentioned. It is very quiet when in sleep mode, and we didn't have to change any settings to do that. You do have to "reach in" a bit to get the papers that have printed, but it's not a big deal. Am looking forward to learning how to use the addl features, but right now, we're glad we bought it. (It is pretty large, compared to other printers we have.) Would definitely buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Mason's Mom

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a champ
customer_reviews.text: Love this, works great. Only occasional issue is wireless stops working, but that hasn’t happened in a year or two. Otherwise SO glad we bought this—does a great job on scanning, printing, everything!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great machine!
customer_reviews.text: I like this printer very much. Once you get everything figured out as to how it works then it is easy to use. It prints quick and the scanner works great. I haven't used the fax and don't expect to need that often but thought it would be good idea to have if I needed it. The important features to me are the printer, scanner and copier. There is one concern I have had with it and that is printing envelopes - you have to adjust something in the back of the machine which means turning the machine around to do this. That could be improved. But overall I would say it is a great machine.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine J Gray

customer_reviews.title: I needed this Immediately
customer_reviews.text: I had a printer in my office which was giving me messages early in January that a major part needed to be replaced. I did make it through April 30th and then it died on May 1st. I found this printer, it was shipped right away, it works great for my needs, great customer service with the delivery on Saturday. I would recommend this printer; the cost is right and the service is exceptional
customer_reviews.author: JEANNE ADAMS

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, is still working after several years.
customer_reviews.text: I use it for my small business and do printing on it everyday. Scans good and toner has a decent lasting time before needing change. It prints only black and white but very good printing.
customer_reviews.author: DMORENO

customer_reviews.title: Not durable.  Internal gears are plastic and get brittle and fail with age.
customer_reviews.text: It lasted for about four years and then all the internal plastic gears broke. Printer was used in a home environment and should have lasted longer. It was used very infrequently!
customer_reviews.author: California Flash

customer_reviews.title: Great for my home office
customer_reviews.text: I spent several hours researching what all in one printer to purchase. I needed something that was affordable to operate, small in size, and with the ability to work on a home network and wirelessly. My biggest need was a good scanner. I am converting all documents in my office to PDF files. The scanner on this little printer fits the bill. This machine has more options than I really need or want. It faxing, fax poling, etc is very extensive, but who faxes any more. Scan and email, so to me all of those options are wasted, but for the price who cares.
customer_reviews.author: Ted F. Prina

customer_reviews.title: replaced an MFC4600 I used since 2002
customer_reviews.text: Great unit, great price, fast ship, easy setup, runs fast and quiet. what's not to like? - The install instructions should tell you not to plug it into a UPS (the online support FAQ's do). I had it crash my system a couple times when it 'woke up' to receive a fax, tripping the UPS breaker. - The iprint/iscan mobile apps are kind of useless. Most small offices use more than one subnet, and the apps can't reach across them, nor can they be configured for a specific ip address.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great little workhorse
customer_reviews.text: This printer has amazed me. It is easy to operate (never had to read the manual!) has a relatively low operating cost, high quality photos and text, and so simple to use wirelessly that I felt like a wizard when everything worked with such a low-effort install. I highly recommend it. I h ave had it nearly a year now, and have not a single complaint. The toner seems to last much longer than I would have expected for the level of output it produces.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Wayne

customer_reviews.title: It's very good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, hooked it up and it seems to be working as intended. Not too sure about all the complaints about it in stand by mode. I don't hear any noise when this thing is not running, even when it's powered on, there's no noise coming out of it. It prints very very fast and high cap toners could do 2400 pages before replacement. Only down side is that I have yet to get the wireless networking features to work for this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Supergood

customer_reviews.title: a good product.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. A bit louder than expected, but great for this price. I had a problem with a vertical line on all scans ... called Brothers support and they walked me through how to resolve the issue in five minutes. I just had to clean the right part of the printer with a piece of cotton. Super friendly and competent. So five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas NYC

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Installation of wireless was easy once I found the right type of USB cable (not included, requires the squarish looking end on one side). You can also install wirelessly but didn't need to try this. Have the machine a couple months now and have had no problems printing and copying so far. Am hopeful that this machine will last longer than the last couple Cannon inkjets I have had.
customer_reviews.author: F.S.C.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these for my office. One of them broke after 2 months; I called customer service and wasted an hour with them over the phone, as they logged in to my computer and tried to convince me it was a network problem. Hardly; the machine itself was broken; it wouldn't recognize the new toner cartridge and kept displaying the 'replace toner' message. I will be bringing it to my local service shop where I am told it is covered under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: BrooklynDoc

customer_reviews.title: quick install. seems to have very high initial quality
customer_reviews.text: I have not used a brother product since their word processors way back in the day. Those were excellent products. This printer is great so far. Installation was easy, intuitive, and without hiccups. I have extensively used HP, Cannon, and even Lexmark back when they made consumer printers. This is by far the best i have used. If it goes t*ts up, I promise a follow up, so if you see no further on this, we are going strong... peace... K
customer_reviews.author: Keith M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Typical Good Brother Product
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for a customer who was moving and needed to replace a big leased copier. Obviously the capacity is not the same, but it works well including networked scanning. Better pricing & features than HP and the least expensive all-in-one that I could find that fully supports PCL for older applications. The customer was merging with another company - and after realizing that there existing machine (older non-networked Brother all-in-one) couldn't handle networked scanning & faxing they bought the exact same model.
customer_reviews.author: Manasseh Katz

customer_reviews.title: I like this printer
customer_reviews.text: I like this printer. Gets the job done just fine but...... The front feed is a pain. I write a lot of checks. The front feed never takes in the check the same way twice. The checks are always printed crooked. I resolved this issue by putting the checks in the paper drawer. This way prints the checks correctly but is kind of a pain. I have to restack all of the checks if I am printing a bunch at the same time because the checks have to go in face down. Like I said, it gets the job done but is a bit of a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: SANDY

customer_reviews.title: We are disappointed with purchase
customer_reviews.text: We are disappointed with purchase. We bought for home use expecting all functionalities would work wirelessly. 1. printing : it takes about 5 minutes for the printer to become available on the computer screen 2. Scanning is possible in wired mode only. 3. very noisy . If don't mind the noise it is great for wired use. I would not buy it for anything wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Omar M Abdi

customer_reviews.title: I really thought it would be an excellent purchase although I am so upset that AMAZON customer ...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately after having the all-in-one BROTHER printer it has failed and will not allow for paper to feed through the paper tray rollers. I really thought it would be an excellent purchase although I am so upset that AMAZON customer support has done absolutely nothing to remedy this situation and the customer service representative was unsure of her responses which I thought was horrible as well. I hope AMAZON customer support picks up the step with fine tuning customer service as they are falling behind in this area. :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC PRINTER/COPIER/SCANNER - SEVERAL FRIENDS HAVE PURCHASED IT TOO
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS PRINTER. I BOUGHT MINE A LITTLE OVER A YEAR AGO AND SINCE THEM, SIX OF MY FRIENDS HAVE BOUGHT IT AND LOVE IT TOO. ONR FRIEND BOUGHT THE SLIGHLTY DIFERENT MODEL WITH A FAX IN IT, BUT I DON'T USE FAXES ANYMORE; I USE THIS WONDERFUL SCANNER AND IT SAVES ME SO MUCH TIME. WATCH FOR IT TO GO ON SALE FREQUENTLY. I GOT MY FOR $99.
customer_reviews.author: Patty P

customer_reviews.title: Brothet wireless laser printer all in one
customer_reviews.text: I have limited space in my room, and this wireless printer came in very handy as I can position it any where. This will replaced my inkjet canon printer, the inkjet sucked - ran out ink if idled for over week even new cartridge, plus print quality sucks. Laser printer never dried up because the toner it use are already dry powders. Another advantage is this all in one Brother printer is light and compact compare to other similiar products.
customer_reviews.author: Henry's dad

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Feb 2014 for our home. Set up easily with all our computers (Windows XP, Vista, 7, and 8) via our wireless network. Has performed well (print/copy/scan, no faxes as of yet), but we've only given it light to moderate use. Still on the original cartridge, but we're getting the 'toner low' messages so we'll see how much longer that element lasts and how the process will be to replace/reset it.
customer_reviews.author: Tinesox

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, but difficult to set up
customer_reviews.text: It does everything it claims to do. Compared to an ink-jet, it's much faster. I have yet to see how much money I can save with ink vs. an inkjet. But overall, I'm happy with its speed. My only complaint is that the programming for wi-fi is very difficult to do. I wish it was more user-friendly. The menu is pretty bare-bone, and not easy to understand.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Fish

customer_reviews.title: Other than toner, I have had to replace my drum twice in two years.
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of printing on this machine and it performs very well. I have it for close to two years and am replacing my second drum. I do not know how long they are suppose to last saw this is my first laser printer. I feel it has saved me a lot of money over my ink jets.
customer_reviews.author: Jay A Thiel

customer_reviews.title: Decent, not wonderful
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of things I like about these printers. I have two very similar (home and office). The one thing I don't like is they keep getting black streaks in the same spot on the scanner. It comes off with cleaning, but it happens on the same spot. Design flaw that is causing it to collect dirt.
customer_reviews.author: J. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Just received!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this printer and completed connection to my computer. It was little noisy when it is running, but after few minutes later, it automatically goes to sleep mode. So, the noise is not bothering me. Quality is good, it is printing fast, scanning fast. Since i don't use fax function, i have no comment on that. Overall, i am satisfied with this printer. Just hoping it will last long.
customer_reviews.author: Ki

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer. Finally a printer that doesn't suck. I'm not expecting much, I just want something to print. I decided to switch to a laser printer since I'm tired of the crap that comes with ink (dries out, streaks, etc.). This thing is so much quicker than my old printers. It was easy to set up and it looks nice. So far I haven't bothered with faxing (don't know why people still fax things these days, but whatever) or some of the other options. I'm just happy I have a decent printer that does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Walton

customer_reviews.title: great printer, fax, copier, scanner
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer, fax, copier, scanner, and it's a laser. No more worrying if ink is dry when you go to use it, like an inkjet. Do I wish it was color, sure, but I knew it was BW when I bought it. The only very minor drawback is so minute I almost hate to mention it. When it's finished printing, it doesn't push the paper out, so you have to reach about an inch in to grab the paper. Otherwise this thing is great.
customer_reviews.author: tjk

customer_reviews.title: love it, love not having to replace ink! works great on wifi with Macs
customer_reviews.text: got sick of replacing ink catridges and many of the ink printers these days have horrible reviews. decided that i didn't need color, as i printed random and non-important stuff all the time--maps, coupons, etc. Best decision ever. The laser prints very quickly and works great on our wifi network with our macs. printing wirelessly is a must since we only own laptops. so far it's worked great and scanning is very easy to do. love it.
customer_reviews.author: MCL

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect printer for printing class notes and business related items. I love how it prints on both sides and it prints fairly quickly and the pages are already in order when it is finished. I love this. My old printer would always have the pages backwards so I can save some time with this printer and paper with the double-sided feature.
customer_reviews.author: Mommyof5

customer_reviews.title: Went well with my older computer and equipment
customer_reviews.text: I really do not like to write reviews, sorry, but I like this machine so far, I went and hooked it in via cable to my router - The instructions were hard to follow, more related to a PC i think. If I could have afforded a newer model that would probably have been easier to hook up. This is my first brother machine. (I was tired of the expense of ink in my epson) so now I have my office work horse. I will be mostly using it for copies, and my online shop labels taxes etc. I am able to print from my phone and tablet through my router, using a downloaded free app for brother printers.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Good multif-unction print
customer_reviews.text: Needed help from brother with printing of envelopes -- counter-intuitively two switches need to be set by the back door to print envelopes, then they require unsetting. Cumbersome process. Would like ... 1. A paper tray that held a full ream of paper, and 2. A scanner that accommodated legal-sized items. Otherwise the this item functions well.
customer_reviews.author: satisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer
customer_reviews.text: I had a Brother MFC 7220 that did an OK job. I got the Brother MFC 7860 DW because of the duplex printing, and the wireless networking. The setup was easy and the wireless printing is great. The duplex printing is also a nice feature. Now if I can use it enough so the toner cartridge doesn't dry out it will be the ideal printer for me.
customer_reviews.author: tpcpilot

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this printer for its scanning abilities....
customer_reviews.text: I thought this printer would be great. I am unable to use the scanner after one month of use. There is a long black line down the middle-right side of every page when I use multiple pages in the scanner. I've tried cleaning it, using online help, etc. I'm really disappointed. My entire office is forced to scan with single pages right now... Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Terrific printer for home office
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Brother MFC that I have owned and it is terrific. I bought it as a printer for my home office and use it frequently. I love the wifi capability and the reasonable consumption of toner. Toner cartridges for this printer cost about $47 on Amazon, which is the cheapest I have found. I have replaced the toner once in 6 months. I would highly recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: love this dependable Brother
customer_reviews.text: love this all-in-one machine. So superior to HP photosmart that only was constant source of grief. My Brother works every time, and I don't miss the always-empty, always expensive, ink cartridge changeouts. Great color scanner, never software issues.
customer_reviews.author: dave beach

customer_reviews.title: Very good service and printer
customer_reviews.text: I like this printer from computer users. I have used it for some time now and works very well. I paid $250.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Brother Printer MFC7860DW Wireless Monochrome Printer with Scanner, Copier & Fax
product_meta.description:
Style:NewThe MFC-7860DW is a laser all-in-one ideal for small offices or home offices. It produces fast, high-quality monochrome laser printing and copying at up to 27ppm, as well as color scanning and high-speed faxing into one space-saving design. It also offers automatic duplex for producing for two-sided output and built-in wireless and Ethernet interfaces for sharing with others on your network.The MFC-7860DW provides flexible paper handling via an adjustable, 250-sheet capacity tray and a manual by-pass slot for printing thicker media. A 35-page capacity automatic document feeder allows you to copy, scan or fax multi-page documents quickly and easily. Additionally, it offers a high-yield 2,600-page replacement toner cartridge to help lower operating costs.What's in the box: Brother MFC-7860DW All-In-One B/W Laser Printer with Wireless Networking and Duplex, Starter Toner Cartridge, DR420 Drum Unit, AC Power Cord, Telephone Line Cord, Installation CD-ROM, Quick Setup Guide, Basic User's Guide and 1-Year Limited Warranty.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


35-page capacity auto document feeder (View Larger.) Easy to install, high-yield toner cartridge
is available for low cost output Produce professional two-sided documents with automatic duplex printing COMPACT LASER ALL-IN-ONE WITH WIRELESS NETWORKING AND DUPLEX PRINTING
The MFC-7860DW is a great addition to any small office or home office. Delivering fast print and copy speeds while producing professional-quality output, this compact, yet powerful, machine is ideal for producing the everyday documents that make up the output of today's busy office. Built-in wireless networking allows you to conveniently place it in your work environment and share it with multiple users. In addition, the MFC-7860DW offers a built-in duplex printing capability for producing two-sided output with ease.

KEY FEATURES
 * Prints and copies up to 27ppm
 * Automatic duplex (two-sided) printing
 * Up to 2400 x 600 dpi print resolution
 * Wireless 802.11 b/g, Ethernet and Hi-Speed USB 2.0 interfaces
 * Adjustable, 250-sheet capacity paper tray for letter or legal size paper
 * 35-page capacity auto document feeder
 * High-quality color scanning up to 19200 dpi (int.)
 * Supports a variety of "scan to" features including: e-mail, file, image, OCR, and FTP
 * 33.6K bps Super G3 fax modem
 * Works with Brother iPrint & Scan free downloadable app
 * 32 MB memory, stores up to 500 pages9
 * Toner Save mode for less critical business documents
 * PC Fax software for sending faxes from your computer
 * Manual feed slot

EXCEPTIONAL PERFORMANCE AND IMAGE QUALITY
Enjoy the convenience of producing high-quality output right from your desktop or small office. With print and copy speeds of up to 27ppm, you can stop wasting time and move on to other important tasks. Print high-quality output at up to 2400 x 600 dpi for professional reports, spreadsheets, correspondence or other important business documents. Use the automatic duplex printing feature to create professional two-sided documents, brochures and booklets. This feature helps you save paper and reduce costs by cutting paper usage in half. Plus, when copying and faxing, you can produce two-sided output from one-sided originals.

FLEXIBLE CONNECTIVITY
Share with others on your wireless 802.11b/g or wired network for printing, scanning and PC faxing5 or connect locally to a single user via its Hi-Speed USB 2.0 interface. Users with wireless access points that support Wi-Fi Protected Setup or AOSS can automatically configure their wireless settings by simply pressing a button on their router.

The MFC-7860DW is compatible with Brother iPrint & Scan, a FREE printing app that enables you to print (JPEG, PDF or web pages) from and scan to your Apple, Android or Windows Phone 7 (JPEG only, scanning not available) mobile device on your wireless network. It is also compatible with Cortado Workplace*, a FREE printing app that enables you to store and wirelessly print common file formats from your Apple, Android, or Blackberry mobile device.

ADVANCED SCANNING CAPABILITIES
The MFC-7860DW offers document scanning with up to 19200 x 19200 dpi (interpolated) scanning resolution, and features management solutions to easily share, archive or edit your paper-based documents electronically. Scan multi-page documents using the 35-page capacity auto document feeder or use the document glass for bound materials or up to letter-size documents.

With the MFC-7860DW, you can create high-quality color scans in a variety of file formats including: PDF, JPG, TIFF, and more. It also offers a wide range of scanning options including: e-mail, file, image, and OCR. You can also scan documents directly to a FTP server or e-mail scanned documents directly to your e-mail server8. The MFC-7860DW includes both TWAIN and WIA (Windows Imaging Acquisition) scanner drivers and Nuance PaperPort SE with OCR for Windows and Presto! PageManager with OCR for Mac for greater flexibility.

LOW COST OF OWNERSHIP
In addition to being affordable to purchase, the MFC-7860DW uses both standard and high-yield replacement toner cartridges. Using the high-yield 2,600-page2 toner cartridge (TN-450) can help lower your operating costs. You also can help save money by using Toner Save Mode for your less critical business documents, and PC Fax to send and receive faxes directly from your computer without having to print them6.

TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS
PRINT
 * Print Technology: Electrophotographic Laser
 * Time to First Page: < 8.5 seconds
 * Automatic Duplex Printing: Yes
 * Printer Emulations: GDI, PCL6, BR-Script3±
 * Standard Interfaces: Wireless 802.11 b/g, Ethernet, Hi-Speed USB 2.0
 * Windows Compatibility: Windows 7 / Windows Vista / XP / XP Professional x64 / 2000 / Server 2003 / 2008
 * Mac Compatibility: Mac OS X 10.4.11, 10.5.x, 10.6.x

FAX
 * Best Transmit Speed: Approx. 2.5 seconds (per page)9
 * Stand-Alone Faxing: Yes
 * Broadcasting (# of locations): Up to 258
 * Quick Scan: Approx. 2.5 seconds (per page)9
 * Fax Forwarding / Paging: Yes / Yes
 * One Touch / Speed Dials: 8 / 200
 * Dual Access: Yes

COPY
 * Stand-Alone Copying: Yes
